entry.title: Armenia will deepen ties with EU, Pashinyan says

media:group.media:title: Armenia will deepen ties with EU, Pashinyan says
media:group.media:description:
üìçPashinyan said Armenia is prepared to sign a peace treaty with Azerbaijan by the end of the year in a speech at the European Parliament. üìçIn addition, Pashinyan said Armenia will deepen relations with the European Union as far as the EU would consider possible, amid fraying ties with Russia. üìçRussian peacekeepers continue dismantling their observation outposts in Nagorno-Karabakh after last month‚Äôs ethnic cleansing of Armenians.
Credits: Ruptly

media:group.media:title: The Last Days in Artsakh | –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –¥–Ω–∏ –ê—Ä—Ü–∞—Ö–∞ | ‘±÷Ä÷Å’°’≠’´ ’æ’•÷Ä’ª’´’∂ ÷Ö÷Ä’•÷Ä’®
media:group.media:description:
Following Azerbaijan‚Äôs attack on #Karabakh on September 19-20, authorities announced the dissolution of the Karabakh Defense Army and state institutions. Tens of thousands of Armenians took whatever belongings they could and gathered in the center of Stepanakert, the region‚Äôs capital. From there began the mass exodus of Armenians from Karabakh. A long line of cars that led to #Kornidzor, #Armenia.
The staff who ran CivilNet‚Äôs #Artsakh newsroom - Hayk Ghazaryan, Hasmik Khachatryan, Siranush Adamyan and Ani Balayan - were among the more than 100,000 Armenians who left behind their homes and their homeland. These are the bits and pieces of their last reporting up until the complete ethnic cleansing of the region.

entry.title: Assessing the UN's Role in the Armenian Genocide in Nagorno-Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Assessing the UN's Role in the Armenian Genocide in Nagorno-Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, Patrick Elliott sits down with Hasmik Egian, a 30-year veteran of the UN who previously oversaw UN Security Council affairs. They discuss the organization's effectiveness in preventing ethnic cleansing and its failures to protect Armenians in Nagorno-Karabakh.
Egian offers insightful perspective from her high-level experience on the challenges the UN faces intervening in conflicts involving UN member states like Azerbaijan. She also discusses lessons that can be learned from this latest outbreak of violence and the need to strengthen the UN's independence and enforcement capabilities.

media:group.media:title: Aliyev tours ethnically cleansed Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev claimed a ‚Äòhistoric victory‚Äô on a visit to Stepanakert, making no mention of the more than 100,000 Armenians who were forcibly displaced from their homes there last month. üìçRussian President Vladimir Putin said he is ready to visit Yerevan, even though Armenia joined the International Criminal Court earlier this month. üìçThe State Department refuted as ‚Äòinaccurate‚Äô a story in the newspaper Politico saying the United States is concerned Azerbaijan may invade Armenia in the coming weeks. üìçThe Armenian government evacuated nearly 200 Armenians from Tel Aviv amid the ongoing war in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories.
Credits: Ruptly

What is traditional Armenian bread? How is it prepared and with what ingredients? To understand these intricacies, Ani moved from Yerevan to Dilijan to create a little research corner. This short film is about how bread has changed the community and the impact that‚Äôs had on Ani.

entry.title: Armenia's Tourism Boom: The Strategy for Record Breaking Growth

media:group.media:title: Armenia's Tourism Boom: The Strategy for Record Breaking Growth
media:group.media:description:
Head of Armenia's Tourism Committee Sisian Boghossian sits down with CivilNet to reveal how Armenia plans to double its annual tourism numbers to over 2 million visitors this year.
Boghossian pulls back the curtain on Armenia's unorthodox strategy that focused on word-of-mouth promotion, guerrilla marketing tactics, and rebranding the country's image globally.
She discusses the challenges Armenia faced after years of political turmoil and economic decline, and how they tapped into cultural tourism and community outreach to boost the tourism sector.
